009package imagingbook.common.geometry.shape;
010
011import java.awt.Shape;
012import java.awt.geom.PathIterator;
013import java.util.ArrayList;
014import java.util.List;
015
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.GeometricEllipse;
018
019/**
020 * Implementing classes know how to create an AWT {@link Shape}.
021 * 
022 * @author WB
023 *
024 */
025public interface ShapeProducer {
026        
027        /**
028         * Returns a scaled {@link Shape} for this object
029         * (default scale is 1).
030         * Must be defined by implementing classes.
031         * The interpretation of the scale factor is left to the implementing class.
032         * For example, for {@link Pnt2d} it specifies the size of the marker 
033         * (see {@link Pnt2d#getShape(double)}.
034         * 
035         * @param scale the scale of the shape
036         * @return a {@link Shape} instance
037         */
038        public Shape getShape(double scale);
039        
040        /**
041         * Returns a {@link Shape} for this object at the
042         * default scale (1).
043         * @return a {@link Shape} instance
044         */
045        public default Shape getShape() {
046                return getShape(1);
047        };
048        
049        /**
050         * Returns a fixed sequence of {@link Shape} items for drawing this object,
051         * which must contain at least one item.
052         * This is to produce graphic representations that are too complex for
053         * a single {@link Shape} item.
054         * The returned shapes may also be displayed with different strokes or colors.
055         * <p>
056         * By default, this method returns a single item which is the primary
057         * shape (obtained by {@link #getShape(double)}).
058         * Implementing classes should override this method if more than one
059         * shape must be returned 
060         * For example, a {@link GeometricEllipse} returns three shape items:
061         * (a) the ellipse curve, (b) the center mark, (c) the major axes
062         * (see {@link GeometricEllipse#getShapes(double)}).
063         * </p>
064         * 
065         * @param scale a scale factor (may be used or ignored)
066         * @return sequence of {@link Shape} items
067         */
068        public default Shape[] getShapes(double scale) {
069                return new Shape[] { getShape(scale) };
070        }
071        
072        public default Shape[] getShapes() {
073                return getShapes(1);
074        }
075        
076        // TODO: experimental
077        public static Pnt2d[] getShapePoints(Shape shape) {
078            double[] coords = new double[6];
079            PathIterator pathIterator = shape.getPathIterator(null);
080
081            List<Pnt2d> points = new ArrayList<>();
082            
083            while (!pathIterator.isDone()) {
084                int segmentType = pathIterator.currentSegment(coords);
085                switch (segmentType) {
086                
087                case PathIterator.SEG_MOVETO :
088                    System.out.printf("move to x1=%f, y1=%f\n", coords[0], coords[1]);
089                    points.add(Pnt2d.from(coords[0], coords[1]));
090                    break;
091                    
092                case PathIterator.SEG_LINETO :
093                    System.out.printf("line to x1=%f, y1=%f\n", coords[0], coords[1]);
094                    points.add(Pnt2d.from(coords[0], coords[1]));
095                    break;
096                    
097                case PathIterator.SEG_QUADTO :
098                    System.out.printf("quad to x1=%f, y1=%f, x2=%f, y2=%f\n", coords[0], coords[1], coords[2], coords[3]);
099                    points.add(Pnt2d.from(coords[0], coords[1]));
100                    break;
101                    
102                case PathIterator.SEG_CUBICTO :
103                    System.out.printf("cubic to x1=%f, y1=%f, x2=%f, y2=%f, x3=%f, y3=%f\n",
104                            coords[0], coords[1], coords[2], coords[3], coords[4], coords[5]);
105                    points.add(Pnt2d.from(coords[0], coords[1]));
106                    break;
107                    
108                case PathIterator.SEG_CLOSE :
109                    System.out.printf("close\n");
110                    break;
111                    
112                default : throw new RuntimeException("unknown path segment type " + segmentType);
113                }
114                
115                
116                pathIterator.next();
117            }
118            return points.toArray(new Pnt2d[points.size()]);
119        }
120        
121        
122}
